identificationModule.briefTitle: PET Study to Evaluate Brain Receptor Occupancy, Safety and Pharmacokinetics of ITI-1284 in Healthy Subjects
identificationModule.officialTitle: An Open-label, Positron Emission Tomography Study to Evaluate Brain Receptor Occupancy, Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics After a Single Sublingual Administration of ITI-1284 in Healthy Subjects

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The study will be conducted as an open-label and single-center study to evaluate the occupancy of ITI-1284 to the dopamine D2 receptor in healthy subjects. Subjects will enroll in one of the 2 cohorts, will have a baseline PET/CT scan, will receive a single dose of ITI-1284, and undergo one postdose PET/CT scan.

primaryOutcomes.description: Percent change of binding potential from baseline

secondaryOutcomes.description: Area under the plasma drug concentration-time curve (AUC) from time zero to the last measurable concentration
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Predose and multiple timepoints up to 24 hours postdose on Day 1
Predose and multiple timepoints up to 24 hours postdose on Day 1
Predose and multiple timepoints up to 24 hours postdose on Day 1

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of subjects with treatment-emergent adverse events
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 30 days after the dose of study drug

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in ECG QT interval
Change from baseline in aspartate aminotransferase
Change from baseline in alanine aminotransferase
